title: Smiddy Shaw Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Peter McDermott / Smiddy Shaw Reservoir
images.caption: View of Smiddy Shaw Reservoir as seen from the C2C path near Skaylock Hill.

images.title: David Collins / Along the dam
images.caption: Along the dam. Smiddy Shaw Reservoir is unusual in that its earthen dam turns back at right angles when at the highest point of the dam.

images.title: John Clive Nicholson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Track on the south side

images.title: Moorland by brian clark, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Moorland

images.title: Track above the valley of the Hisehope Burn by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Track above the valley of the Hisehope Burn. This area lies just north of the reservoir.

images.title: Leat linking Hisehope Reservoir and Smiddy Shaw Reservoir by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Leat linking Hisehope Reservoir and Smiddy Shaw Reservoir. Follow this west and it will take you to Hisehope Reservoir.

images.title: Hisehope Reservoir by Peter McDermott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hisehope Reservoir. Just over a mile from the lake.

images.title: Heather moorland beside Waskerley Way by Trevor Littlewood, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Heather moorland beside Waskerley Way. Pick up this trail to the south of the reservoir and enjoy views from afar.

description: This walk visits Smiddy Shaw Reservoir on Muggleswick Common near Consett in County Durham. There's a nice gravel footpath running around the reservoir with fine views across the water to the surrounding fields. You can start the walk from the public car park located at the eastern end of the water, near to Blackpool Hill. It's easy to extend your reservoir walking by heading south to the Waskerley Reservoir Way or west to Hisehope Reservoir. Tunstall Reservoir is only a few miles to the south as well.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Nana B's Teas is located just to the east of the reservoir on the Waskerley Way. They serve a good range of meals and snacks in lovely surroundings. You can find them at postcode DH8 9HR just over a mile east of the reservoir. They are dog friendly with a water bowl available.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the North Pennines Walks page.

display_address: Nanny Mayer's Incline, Waskerley, Muggleswick, County Durham, North East, England, DH8 9DZ, United Kingdom
